value.title: Data analysis in Power BI
value.excerpt: Report authors can use additional features to enhance their reports for analytical insights in their data with features like Q&A and exporting. In this module, you will closely examine your data and Power BI reports and then extract value with deeper analysis. Additionally, you will learn how to sort data and how to present the report in a cohesive manner. You will learn how to get a statistical summary for your data and export data from Power BI. You will also apply and perform advanced analytics on the report for deeper and more meaningful data insights.

topItems.title: Perform analytics in Power BIÂ
topItems.excerpt: You will learn how to use Power BI to perform data analytical functions, how to identify outliers in your data, how to group data together, and how to bin data for analysis. You will also learn how to perform time series analysis. Finally, you will work with advanced analytic features of Power BI, such as Quick Insights, AI Insights, and the Analyze feature.

topItems.title: Work with AI visuals in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: This module describes the AI capabilities of Power BI.

value.title: Work with AI visuals in Power BI
value.excerpt: This module describes the AI capabilities of Power BI.

value.title: Describe Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn about the Power BI Desktop model structure, star schema design basics, analytics queries, and report visual configuration. This module provides a strong foundation on which you can learn to optimize model designs and add model calculations.

value.title: Explore what Power BI can do for you
value.excerpt: As a consumer, you'll work in the Power BI service to review and interact with content that has been shared with you. This module provides the foundational information that you need to work effectively in the Power BI service.

value.title: Publish and share in Power BI
value.excerpt: Publish and share your Power BI reports and dashboards to teammates in your organization or to everyone on the web.

value.title: Use visuals in Power BI
value.excerpt: Create and customize visuals to present data in compelling and insightful ways.

value.title: Append and Merge Tables in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how to quickly merge and append tables using the query editior in Power BI. Build models with multiple data sources. Contact me on LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/in/gaelimholland
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/CW-Er8slv9k" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Price Prediction with Python and Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how to create a machine learning price prediction using Python machine learning linear regression model and a dataset of 54,000 diamonds. This will be ported over to Power BI for a deeper level of interaction.  You can find the files and dataset here: https://github.com/Gaelim/Diamond-Price-Prediction

value.title: DAX Fridays! #77: GROUPBY, CURRENTGROUP
value.excerpt: In today's DAX Fridays, we will go through the DAX function GROUPBY with an example.  GROUPBY is similar as SUMMARIZE, but the difference is that in the expression part, you use DAX iterators to get your results. You can also nest GROUPBY functions to get for example the highest sales amount by country.

As you probably have noticed, sometimes people use a column in the filter part of CALCULATE and sometimes they use the FILTER function.  The question is, when should you use what? value.title: Schedule data downloads / exports in Power BI
value.excerpt: You can export data or download data out of Power BI in many different ways and depending on the source, you can schedule refresh those data dumps too.   In this video, I will give you one example on how to do that.  Other resources mentioned in this video: Export data with DAX Studio: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-Gfgnk6R0Qw
